six_hat_analysis.white: design.txt defines authoritative tasks; src/App.jsx missing; uiSlice persists layout; FileExplorer wired to IPC; CodeEditor monolithic; feature flags needed.
six_hat_analysis.red: Users need a reliable shell first; avoid exposing VM controls without flags.
six_hat_analysis.black: Risks: introducing dead UI, unguarded stubs, perf regressions; split panes must be accessible.
six_hat_analysis.yellow: Redux persistence already configured; dialogs/components exist; IPC helpers available.
six_hat_analysis.green: Use simple custom resizers with ARIA; modularize editor later; onboarding modal guided.
six_hat_analysis.blue: Implement App shell, wire MenuBar, onboarding, feature flags, then proceed to decomposition and tool UX improvements strictly per DoD.

data.denoised_plan: Implement thin App orchestrator with accessible split panes and persisted sizes; wire MenuBar to real state changes and dialogs; add onboarding flow and feature flags; ensure root-level dialogs are controlled via Redux; gate VM/Cloud features. Defer editor decomposition and advanced flows to subsequent steps per design.txt.
